text: How much business knowledge do you need, to be an effective developer?
Most contract roles I have gone for, target developers with excellent business knowledge, especially in investment banking.
Their reasoning is that they are a better, well rounded developer, that can come up with better design solutions, with added value - which I tend to agree with.
Also I have been turned down for roles because I don't have enough business knowledge, which can be very frustrating indeed.
This can be a big problem when you're just starting out.
The problem is how much business knowledge should I choose to learn?
50/50, 25/75 or keep to being a pure technician?
